Conclusion
Your Memory System is already solving a real problem for real users. The engineering is solid, the user experience is functional, and the core value proposition is clear. This is exactly the right time to implement a freemium model and start learning from paying customers.

The 30-use limit creates natural urgency without being punitive, the $5 price point is low enough to minimize decision friction but high enough to filter for committed users, and the implementation path leverages all your existing infrastructure.

I recommend proceeding with the freemium implementation immediately. The market validation and revenue data you'll gather over the next 90 days will inform all future technical and product decisions much more effectively than architectural speculation.

Your system is ready. Your users are ready. The market is ready. Let's monetize this solution and start building a sustainable business around the value you've already created.

Edit
You've identified a critical UX friction point! The photo-based 2FA is definitely unusual and could be driving away potential free users who just want to try the system quickly. Here's a strategic approach:

Tiered Authentication Strategy
Free Tier: Friction-Free Entry
Email + Password only (traditional signup)
No photo requirement for free accounts
30 conversations max - enough to evaluate value
Quick onboarding - "Start saving conversations in 30 seconds"
Paid Tier: Enhanced Security
Photo-based 2FA required when upgrading to paid
